description: Allegations against Brett Kavanaugh have raised questions about the ways men behaved in high school.
title: Men, Tell Us About Your High School Experience
title_page: Opinion | Men, Tell Us About Your High School Experience - The New York Times
text:
Christine Blasey Ford's claim that she was assaulted by Brett Kavanaugh, the Supreme Court nominee, when they were both in high school 36 years ago has sparked a national debate about teenage sexual behavior â€“ and whether it has changed.
We want to hear from men about their high school experiences. A Times editor may contact you with follow-up questions. No information you provide will be published without your permission.
Did you ever, as a teenager or younger man, behave toward women in ways you may now regret? If so, how? And how has that experience stayed with you over the years? * You have 175 words left.
How old were you when you had this experience? * You have 5 characters left.
Has the way you think about the incident changed over time? If so, when did you start thinking about it differently, and why? * You have 150 words left.
Have standards of what constitutes unacceptable behavior changed since then? Have you? * You have 150 words left.
How old are you? In what year did you graduate? * You have 20 characters left.
